intro: Ortholoma erythrophyllum, commonly known as the red-leaf ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. Due to its limited range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
